content.question: Based on the data shown in the graph, which of the following is the most plausible hypothesis for the cause of the trend in <math alttext="C O 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>C</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> levels from about 5,000 years ago to the present?

choices.label: Volcanic activity, which can release over 6 million tons of carbon dioxide per year, has contributed to an increase in ash and dust in the atmosphere, which trap <math alttext="C O 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>C</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>. This has caused an increase in <math alttext="C O 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>C</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> in the atmosphere over the past 5,000 years.

Human activity, especially the burning of fossil fuels, has led to an increase in anthropogenic carbon dioxide emissions. This has caused a doubling in the concentration of <math alttext="C O 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>C</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> in the atmosphere.

Erosion of limestone from sedimentary rock, a result of physical and biological weathering, has released a large amount of carbonic acid into the atmosphere. This has caused a decrease in the concentration of <math alttext="C O 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>C</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> in the atmosphere.

Increasing rates of photosynthesis in the summers, which are a direct result of increased global temperatures, have led to an increased release of <math alttext="C O 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>C</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> in warmer months. This has caused the seasonal cycle of <math alttext="C O 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>C</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> concentrations in the atmosphere.

content.answer: Human activity, especially the burning of fossil fuels, has led to an increase in anthropogenic carbon dioxide emissions. This has caused a doubling in the concentration of <math alttext="C O 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>C</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> in the atmosphere.
